column5: Today started out very slow & then in 20 minutes I had 3 Smallies with #4 coming shortly after that, Darcy couldn't buy a fish today even when he was using the same Tubes Richard
Nice fish, it looks cold up there! I have debated trying out front of Pickering B  do you work at the Bruce? I have a job offer to go up there that I am debating taking
Always lots of smallies of the nuke plants, gotta make sure the winds are safe. Thanks for posting.

No I'm not a Hydroid, I haven't even fished there that often but I'll likely be out there a bit more, 1st video was out there, we have had a few 50 Smallie days out there but its slowed down so we switched over to a smaller lake that was rough enough with sw winds at 20 km/hr, I had the plug in my live well & didn't turn it on & when we got out of the water the live well was 1/2 full from waves coming over the nose of the Boat, it wasn't to bad of a day but the water temp was 42 degrees Richard
Nice video Richard, thanks for sharing.  Doug.

Yeah, I have heard that in front of the Pickering plant it is pretty good aswell for smallies and some other species aswell, especially when the water temps go down in the rest of the lake, security doesnt like it too much when people get close, but there isnt anything that they can do, I am just nervous to head into the big lake seeing as I only have a 14' tinnie!  Wow, that sounds like a rough day on the water, I dont mind a little spray, but this time of year it gets cold fast once you are wet!
A buddy & I had to go to work at 2:30am today so we're done off to the big lake east wind ya who, there are guys out there with 12' aluminum maybe smaller just pick your days & watch the wind Richard
It sure looks cold out there and them bass, sure are putting on the feed Great job Richard!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
